name: Lead Data Engineer
description:
We’re looking for someone to lead a data engineering team that provides critical information to the Marketing division. It's important that you're interested in both management functions and tech tasks, as this role is perfect for combining these two areas!

Workflow:

We currently have a data infrastructure based on cloud solutions as well as on-premise databases. As the Lead Data Engineer, you'll be managing a team of two specialists who work on data warehouse organization and develop new services for real-time data enrichment. The Lead Data Engineer is focused on helping Marketing Operations support lead generation and analyze marketing campaigns.

What you'll do:

  • Lead, coach, and empower a team of data engineers (two members) to deliver great results
  • Set and communicate team goals and your vision for the future
  • Plan, delegate, and execute long- and short-term goals to support marketing operations and improvement of DE
  • Build data infrastructure for marketing analysts, construct ETL and stream processing pipelines, and develop microservices for data enrichment
  • Ensure our tools, infrastructure, and processes constantly improve to support long-term business growth
  • Partner with the product, business, and marketing analytics teams; prioritize requests based on business value and engineering stage to ensure that our infrastructure functions smoothly and reliably and matches all stakeholders' needs
  • Communicate key results to (senior) management in verbal, visual, and written format

Our tech stack:

Python, Google Cloud Platform, BigQuery, PostgreSQL, Airflow

What we're looking for (i.e., why you’re great for the position):

  • 2+ years of relevant work experience (data engineering, backend with emphasis on data processing, and data science with an emphasis on infrastructure)
  • Strong knowledge of SQL and Python (or Java/Scala/C++/C# with an understanding of Python Syntax)
  • Strong erudition in engineering and preferably experience with data streaming
  • Management experience: preferably team lead, manager, mentor
  • Ability to work as "Playing Lead": act simultaneously as a data engineering professional + manage your team
  • Business maturity: value prioritization, long-term vision, and efficient balance between strategy and tactics
  • Boldness to sign up for ambitious goals
  • Ability to work without frequent supervision while delivering promised results
  • Superb communication and negotiation skills
  • Ability to speak/write in English at an upper-intermediate level or better
branded_description:
Wrike is a leading project collaboration cloud software with an innovative product that helps thousands of customers in 130 countries manage their projects, businesses, and employees.

It is loved by global brands like Google, Airbnb, L'Oreal, Western Union, Fitbit, Hootsuite, Greenpeace, and startups around.

  • Ability to work without frequent supervision while delivering promised results
  • Superb communication and negotiation skills
  • Ability to speak/write in English at an upper-intermediate level or better

BENEFITS

White salary and flexible work schedule

Sport activities (volleyball, basketball, yoga)

Parties and off-site events that you’ll never forget

Massage chair, shower, gym, Xbox

Snacks, cookies, fruit, vegetables, and dairy

Free office lunches and 50% parking compensation

English classes in the office (also with a native speaker)

Advanced medical insurance for children and spouses as well

Relocation bonus for candidates moving from other cities
